intro: Sida hyssopifolia, commonly known as blueweed or Mexican blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It features small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from summer to fall. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Sida hyssopifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
